result.execSummary:
The defendant Arthur A. Freiboth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was granted 2 days for time served
Consecutive to: Any other prison sentence out there

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
AMENDED 5-1-2015 PER THE COURT, RESTITUTION IS TO BE PAID TO THE VICTIM FIRST WITH CRIME VICTIM WITNESS SERVICES,ANY INSURANCE COMPANY, SUPERVISION FEES AND COURT COSTS TO FOLLOW.
AMENDED PER ORDER OF THE COURT, 8-5-2015, TOTAL RESTITUTION AMENDED(INCREASED) FROM $118,574.69 TO $124,023.09 WITH THE 10% AND 5% SURCHARGES INCREASED ACCORDINGLY.

Fees, surcharges and costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Defendant is ordered to pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge, provide a sample for testing through the Dept. of Corrections as required in felony convictions.

Defendant is to remain employed, if not, he is to do job searches as directed by his agent, reporting them to his agent.  If the defendant's occupation involves a commercial motor vehicle license, he is required to pay the costs of a random urinalysis for a drug sampling and that the drug sampling be done on a basis of at least every three weeks.   If he does not comply with the request or fails the test even once, the occupation of using a commercial motor vehicle is prohibited.  If the Department of Corrections or his probation agent does not believe taking a test every three weeks is necessary, then he has to have one done privately and provide those results to the agent on a basis of not less then every three weeks.
Defendant shall attend/complete any/all counseling, treatments, evaluations, programming as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with D.B. or any member of her family, of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  He is to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant is not to possess or take any medications/drugs unless prescribed by a doctor and they are to be taken as prescribed.

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  
The defendant shall submit to random urine testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement and this testing will be paid by the defendant.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence out there
